div.l: And namely the miller wele a wey
Thus pleyneth Iohn as he goth by the wey
Towarde the mille and beyerde in his honde
The miller sittinge by the fire he fonde
For it is night and ferther might he naught
For the loue of god thei him be sought
Of herburgh and of ease as for her penye
The miller seid ageyn yf there be enye
Such as it is yette shalle ye haue parte
Myn hous is straite but haue ye lerned arte
Ye can by argumentes make a place
A myle brode of twenty fote of space
Lette see nowe if this place may suafficesafficesuffice
Or maketh it rome wᵗith youre spech as is yoʳur gise
Nowe Symonde seide this Iohn by seint cuthberte
Ay ys thou mery and that ys feire answerde
I haue herde seid men shulde take such of two thinges
Swilke as he finte or swilke as he bringes
But specially I pray the hooste dere
Gete vs sōmme mete and drinke and make vs chere
And we shulle pay truely at the fulle
With empty hondes men may none hawkes tulle
Loo here oure siluer redy for to spende
This miller in to the toun his doughter sende
For ale and brede and rosted hem a goos
And bounde hir hors it shulde no more goo loos
And in his owen chambre made hem a bedde
With shetes and with chalons feire y spredde
Nat frome his owen bedde ten fete or twelue
His doughter hadde a bedde all by hir selue
Right in the same chambre by and bye
It myght be no bette and cause whie
There was noo rommer herburgh in þat place
Thei sopen and thei speke hem to solace
And drunken euer stronge ale of the beste
Aboute mydnyght went they to reste
Welle hath this miller vernisshed his hede
Fulle pale he was for drunken and nat rede
He yexeth and he speketh thurgh the nose
As he were on the quak or in the pose
To bedde he goth and with him goth his wife
As eny iay she was light and iolife
Soo was her ioly whistell well ywhette
The cradell at hir beddes fete is sette
To rokken and to yeve the childe souke
And whenne that alle was drunken in the crowke
To bedde wente the doughter right anone
To bedde goth Aleyne and alsoo Iohn
Ther was nomore there nedeth no dwale
This miller hath so wisely bibbed ale
That as an hors he snorteth in his slepe
Ne of his taill behinde he toke no kepe
His wife bare him a burdon a full stronge
Menne might here hir rowtinge a furlonge
This wench routeth eke par companye
Aleyn the clerke thoo herde this melodye
He pucked Iohn and seide slepeste thoue
Hardeste thoue euer suche a companye
Loo swilke a couplinge is bitwix hem all
A wilde fire on hir bodies falle
Whoo herde euer swilke a ferly thinge
They shull haue the floure of ill endinge
This longe night ther tideth me no reste
But yet no force all shall be for the beste
For Iohn quoth he as euer mote I thryve
If that I may yonde wench shall I swyve
Sōmme easement hath lawe y shapen vs
For Iohn there is a lawe that seith thus
That if a man in one poynte be greved
That in a nother he shall bee releved
Oure corne is stolen sothly it is no naye
And we han hadde an yll fitte to daye
And I shall haue a none a mendemente
Ageyne my losse I shall haue easemente
By goddes soule it shall none other bee
This Iohn answerde Aleyne avise thee
